Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, one on land (like a playground or forest) and one in water (like a pond or stream).
The student can include a variety of living things in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, or animals like squirrels and fish.
The student can show different kinds of plants in each habitat.
The student can show different kinds of animals in each habitat.
The student can compare the living things found in both habitats by highlighting differences and similarities.
The student can illustrate patterns observed, such as the kinds of plants or animals found in similar habitats.
